subject: Writing
title: Upton Sinclair and The Jungle
description: One-minute skill: Upton Sinclair and The Jungle.

hook.text: Sinclair wanted to expose labor exploitation. Instead, his book about meatpacking horrified everyone's stomach.

buildup.text: He spent seven weeks undercover in Chicago's stockyards, documenting conditions for The Jungle in 1906.

discovery.text: His book described rats ground into sausage, workers falling into rendering tanks, and diseased meat sold to the public.

twist.text: Sinclair aimed for the heart of labor reform but hit the stomach â€” food safety laws changed, not worker protections.

climax.text: The book led directly to the Pure Food and Drug Act and the Meat Inspection Act of 1906.

punchline.text: He aimed at their hearts and accidentally hit their stomachs.

quiz.question: What legislation resulted from Upton Sinclair's The Jungle?
options: The Pure Food and Drug Act
